description: This wine only grows more compelling the longer it sits open. It begins with aromas of blackberry, thyme stems and singed tobacco on the nose, leading into a woody palate of dried sage, cracked pepper and fresh blackberry. All of the elements converge into savory excellence with patience. Drink 2021–2035.
title: Sanguis 2015 1/1 Syrah (Central Coast)

description: Made with dried Malvasia and Trebbiano grapes, this meditation wine offers aromas of chestnut honey, caramel and nutmeg. The spicy, balanced palate offers candied tangerine, dried fig and toasted almond alongside fresh acidity and a lingering finish.
title: Avignonesi 2002  Vin Santo di Montepulciano

description: Top of the range from this producer, this complex, dense wine is still packed with young, developing tannins. Two years in wood enhances the smoky character. The rich structure, black fruits and concentration all show this wine will age. Drink from 2022.
title: Bernard Baudry 2016 La Croix Boissée  (Chinon)

description: This wine has a smoky quality, with ripe tannins and dense blackberry and spice flavors as well as wonderful freshness. The wine has considerable potential, rich in tannins and acidity. It will be ready to drink from 2025.
title: Château Beau-Séjour Bécot 2016  Saint-Émilion

description: Beautifully perfumed and rich, this wine comes from the eastern edge of the great plateau of Pomerol. It shows the density and concentration of impressive Merlot. Offering powerful fruits as much as tannins, the wine also has a mineral edge plus fresh acidity to give it a lift. Drink from 2024.
title: Château La Conseillante 2016  Pomerol

description: This impressive white delivers a core of quince, lemon rind and apple that blends with accents of white flower and lemongrass. Crisp acidity drives the freshness on the textured palate, offering elegance and plenty of layers of intrigue. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy 2021–2026.
title: Hanzell 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Aromas of forest floor, fragrant purple flower, Mediterranean scrub, and woodland berry take shape in the glass. Smooth, structured and balanced, the savory palate doles out ripe plum, black cherry, baking spice and tobacco framed in polished tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced while an espresso note closes the finish. Drink 2021–2028.
title: Podere Le Ripi 2013 Lupi e Sirene Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Perfumed and all about finesse, this focused red (the result of a long-term project) is the latest addition to the firm's stellar lineup. It opens with enticing aromas of fragrant purple flower, wild berry, truffle, baking spice and a whiff of crushed herb. Smooth and radiant, it delivers crushed cherry, raspberry compote, mint and star anise flavors set against taut polished tannins. Bright acidity lends balance and tension. Drink 2021–2036.
title: Selvapiana 2016 Vigneto Erchi  (Chianti Rufina)

description: Camphor, wild berry, violet, crushed herb and pipe tobacco aromas align in the glass. Savory and elegant, the focused palate shows a youthful tension while a mineral vein underscores juicy red cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and baking spice. Bright acidity keeps it balanced. Drink 2023–2038.
title: Sesti 2013 Phenomena Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Joshua Klapper takes the extremely cool-climate vines of Presqu'ile Vineyard and works refreshing magic, presenting a wine with complex aromas of plum, roasted cherry, dried sage, pine needle and peppercorn. The palate is bright with raspberry yet lifted by frankincense and sandalwood, proving delicate but immensely expressive.
title: Timbre 2015 The Headliner Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Tar, leather and coffee flavors ride along a velvety body of integrated and richly woven texture in this beautiful wine, blended to great floral and herbal effect, with 12% Cabernet Franc. Black licorice, black cherry and firm tannins make for a stellar and seamless experience dripping in lasting richness.
title: Amici 2015 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: The estate, at the southern end of Saint-Julien, has produced a wine that is both structured and stylish. This bold, ripe wine shows opulent black fruits and generous tannins. Juicy and structured, it has good aging potential. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Branaire-Ducru 2016  Saint-Julien

description: Packed with young tannins, this wine shows the structure of the vintage as well as its fresh and perfumed fruit. The combination will develop to produce a restrained and elegant wine. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Carbonnieux 2016  Pessac-Léognan

description: Ripe, bold fruits mark out this opulent wine. Its rich tannins are typical of the estate and of the vintage. Serious concentration is balanced with good acidity to give a generous wine that also has the structure for aging. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Léoville Poyferré 2016  Saint-Julien

description: Dense tannins are balanced by equally rich fruit in this wine. It comes from vines around a medieval, moated castle on the edge of Bordeaux city. The wine is full of ripe, juicy blackberry flavors that circle of core of dryness. Both will allow the wine to age well. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Olivier 2016  Pessac-Léognan

description: This rich, warm wine offers tannins cushioned within layers of black fruits. It is dense with structure and fruit while also having the freshness and acidity typical of this vintage. The wine will age for several years, becoming richer and more opulent. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Pape Clément 2016  Pessac-Léognan

description: Blue-flower, iris, spiced berry, new leather and damp earth aromas shape the enticing nose. The smooth elegant palate has great focus, doling out juicy Morello cherry, strawberry compote and tobacco framed in polished tannins. Bright acidity keeps it impeccably balance and lends nice tension that carries through to the licorice close. Drink 2021–2033.
title: Donatella Cinelli Colombini 2013 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: This mineral-driven wine is densely fruited while also impressively structured. A single-vineyard wine from the plateau of Saint-Émilion, it offers palpable concentration that's dark and full of black plum flavor. It's elegant, fresh and juicy, but will benefit from aging. Drink from 2024.
title: JCP Maltus 2016 Les Astéries  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Based on the magnificent Quinta de Roriz, this wine is a joint venture between the French Prats family and the Portuguese Symingtons. What has now become an icon wine is made with a nod to Bordeaux, richly structured while also elegant and layering tannins and fruit. It is obviously a wine to age, so wait until 2023.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2016 Chryseia Red (Douro)

description: Like Rippon itself, which perches in solitude at the edge of Lake Wanaka, 35 miles north of Central Otago, the wines are singular, inimitable evocations of the water, mountains and schist soils of this historic biodynamic farm. This Riesling sings with a honey-flecked orchard fruit aroma and bright minerality. The palate reveals layer upon layer of pear, honeysuckle and crushed stone, all sitting on a chalky texture and crunchy acidity.
title: Rippon 2016 Mature Vine Lake Wanaka Riesling (Central Otago)
